question: Which country was the location of the "Ramadan Revolution"?
explanation: Iraq was the location of the "Ramadan Revolution". The Ramadan Revolution also referred to as the 8 February Revolution and the February 1963 coup d'etat in Iraq, was a military coup by the Ba'ath Party's Iraqi-wing which overthrew the Prime Minister of Iraq, Abd al-Karim Qasim in 1963. It took place between 8 and 10 February 1963. Qasim's former deputy, Abdul Salam Arif, who was not a Ba'athist, was given the largely ceremonial title of President, while prominent Ba'athist general Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr was named Prime Minister.
